item.description:
The next HAC book discussion will be on Saturday, May 22, 3 p.m. until 5 p.m. Marsha Zellner has graciously offered to hold our next meeting at her home in Woodbridge. The book we will be reading is "Justice: What's the Right Thing to Do?" by Michael J. Sandel. (Note: This is not the paperback "Justice: A Reader" by the same author.) Lots of copies are available in Connecticut public libraries as well as in book stores and online. Please bring a snack to share (no meat or seafood, please).


Directions to Marsha's home will be sent to people who RSVP "Yes".

For those who want to supplement reading the book with videos (which is definitely recommended), below are some web sites you should visit.

Here is a 4-minute intro video that will give you a quick introduction:
http://www.justicehar...

Here is a 26-minute introductory video
http://athome.harvard...

Here you have 12 episodes of about 55 minutes each:
http://www.justicehar...




Note on updates

To get the latest information on this Meetup as well as our other events, sign up for the HAC Announcements list. To sign up, go to www.cthumanist.org and click on "Lists" and then click on "Hac-announce."
